intro: Myosotis spatulata, commonly known as the spoonleaf forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. Myosotis spatulata is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native habitat.
